OH stricly OH- is the hydroxyl ion, and this highly reactive ion combines with CH4 in the atmosphere to form CO2 and H2O. This is why methane has a short lifetime in the atmosphere. Because OH is reactive, it will quickly find something to react with, so it has a very, very short lifetime.
